entries.title: Germany coup plot: Far-right cell targeted many senior officials including Scholz
entries.description: According to investigators, the commando group dismantled last week was not only planning to seize the Bundestag.

entries.title: Biden tells African leaders US is 'all in' on the continent
entries.description: US President Joe Biden told dozens of African leaders gathered in Washington that the United States is 'all in on Africa’s future.'

entries.title: World Cup Semi-Final: France up 1 over Morocco as Hernandez scores
entries.description: France and Morocco battle it out to face Argentina on Sunday in the 2022 World Cup final.

entries.title: Peru declares state of emergency as ousted leader remains in prison
entries.description: The nationwide state of emergency is set to last for 30 days. The announcement came after a judge ordered ousted ex-president Pedro Castillo to stay in prison.

entries.title: Three generous recipes for Christmas
entries.description: Children, friends, cousins, neighbors... Here are three special recipes for all ages, from 7 to 77.

entries.title: Lost and (almost always) found: The wonder of Japan's lost property centers
entries.description: Japan is developing a nationwide database to improve the management of its lost and found system, which returns around 80% of items to their owners.

entries.title: 'Avatar: The Way of the Water': James Cameron's cosmic western loses its charm
entries.description: The second installment of the Canadian filmmaker's space epic does not have the same dramatic effect as its record-breaking predecessor.

entries.title: World Cup 2022: Will Les Bleus manage to crack open the Moroccan safe?
entries.description: In the World Cup semi-final, the French team is about to face the best defense of the tournament. If they can find the key, they will qualify for their second consecutive final.

entries.title: Energy crisis: 'France faces blackouts for lack of common sense'
entries.description: 'Le Monde' journalist Stéphane Lauer blames both the government and the opposition for the way they handled the possible planned power cuts that could occur this winter.

entries.title: Inside Ukraine's secret drone factories
entries.description: Ukrainian specialists are coming together in the midst of war to create these discreet, silent and deadly weapons in a handful of secret workshops across the country.

entries.title: French prosecutors search Macron's party, McKinsey Paris offices
entries.description: Two investigations are underway over inconsistent campaign accounting and alleged favoritism during the presidential campaigns of 2017 and 2022.

entries.title: Georgia's jailed ex-leader Saakashvili starts new hunger strike, says lawyer
entries.description: Last year, the former president went on hunger strike for 50 days to protest against his jailing.

entries.title: World Cup 2022: French far right finds sudden interest in football ahead of Morocco match
entries.description: Some far-right politicians see the France-Morocco semifinal as 'a footballing clash of civilizations', and accuse Moroccan fans of committing violent acts.

entries.title: EU fails again to agree on gas price cap
entries.description: Meeting in Brussels on Tuesday to find ways to curb energy inflation, EU heads of state and government stumbled on the price limit for transactions in Europe.

entries.title: World Cup 2022: France-Morocco is about more than football
entries.description: The meeting of the French and Moroccan teams on Wednesday in a semifinal of the World Cup in Qatar is heavy with symbolism. For many, this elite-level match is a triumph over the pains and humiliations linked to immigration.

entries.title: World Cup 2022: 'Whatever happens between France and Morocco, I'll win'
entries.description: Moroccans in France are passionate about Wednesday's semi-final. If many do not want to choose between the country they live in and their country of origin, all are thrilled to see an African team go this far.

entries.title: Major small boat rescue operation launched in Channel
entries.description: The UK Maritime and Coastguard Agency said it was coordinating the rescue operation, which involves the British and French navies.

entries.title: Nice attack trial: Despite 'gray areas,' a verdict commensurate with 'national trauma'
entries.description: The court sentenced two defendants to 18 years in prison for terrorism, a sentence harsher than the prosecution had requested. The other six all received sentences that ranged from two to 12 years in prison.

entries.title: World Cup 2022: Didier Deschamps, the starting XI, and the happy substitutes
entries.description: Against Morocco, the French coach will likely align the same starters as usual. Though he relies mainly on a core group of players, one of his strengths is his tactful management of substitutes and their involvement in the team spirit.

entries.title: Ukraine receives new aid from allies to face Russian 'energy terror'
entries.description: More than €1 billion were promised to Ukraine by 48 countries and 24 international organizations at the Paris conference held Tuesday. Of this amount, €415 million have already been earmarked for the energy sector.

entries.title: The death of Angelo Badalamenti, David Lynch's favorite composer
entries.description: The American musician, who died on December 11 at the age of 85, had become famous for the soundtrack of the series 'Twin Peaks.'

entries.title: World Cup 2022: History and politics made Moroccan football what it is
entries.description: The sport is considered a matter of 'supreme national interest' in Morocco, where King Hassan II was used to personally interfering in the handling of the national team.

entries.title: Indian, Chinese troops clash at border in fresh faceoff
entries.description: Clashes on the disputed Himalayan border left troops on both sides injured last week.

entries.title: Kyiv mayor reports drone strikes in center of Ukrainian capital
entries.description: Two administrative buildings were hit according to the city's mayor. There was no immediate report of casualties.

entries.title: French government presents updated plan to encourage carpooling
entries.description: The transport and environment ministries are promising €100 to drivers who sign up for carpooling and €100 million to support local authorities in developing incentives.

entries.title: World Cup 2022: Argentina's Julian Alvarez moves into the spotlight against Croatia
entries.description: The young striker made an impression as the ideal complement to Lionel Messi. On Tuesday, he scored twice in the semi-final of the World Cup against Croatia (3-0).

entries.title: War in Ukraine: In Romania, France deploys 'high-intensity' Leclerc tanks
entries.description: In Cincu, France and its allies are mobilizing its forces to avoid any expansion of the Ukranian conflict into the borders of NATO countries.

entries.title: Brazil: Lula begins to form government, appoints several loyalists to cabinet
entries.description: Before taking office on January 1, the next president had his election certified by the Superior Electoral Court.

entries.title: Algerians are unexpectedly supporting the Moroccan football team
entries.description: Although political relations between the two countries are at an all-time low, Algerian football fans are happy to see the Moroccan team shine at the World Cup.

entries.title: In Hong Kong, Jimmy Lai's legal setbacks undermine the reputation of the local justice system
entries.description: The former media mogul, who Beijing fiercely criticizes for his close ties to Washington, has been issued a new five-year prison sentence.

entries.title: World Cup 2022: Morocco, pride of the Arab world and Palestinian flag bearer
entries.description: The Atlas Lions' performance at the World Cup in Qatar is being celebrated from Oman to Agadir, providing a rare moment of joy in a region suffering a string of crises.

entries.title: Joe Biden signs into law same-sex marriage bill
entries.description: During a ceremony on the White House lawn, the American president described the bill as a 'blow against hate.'

entries.title: At least 100 killed in flood that hits DR Congo's capital
entries.description: The president of the Democratic Republic of Congo joined the United States on Tuesday in blaming climate change for major floods.
